title: How to Make Cinnamon Roll Waffles

steps.headline: Microwave the milk in the small microwaveable bowl for 30 seconds.
steps.description: Then dissolve the yeast into the warm milk in the large mixing bowl.

steps.headline: Add the eggs, granulated sugar, soften butter, salt, and 4 cups of flour into the large mixing bowl.
steps.description: With the wooden spoon, mix the ingredients well.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the rest of the 1/2 cup of flour to knead the dough into a large ball inside the large mixing bowl using your hands.
Cover the large mixing bowl with plastic wrap and leave the bowl on the counter for 1 hour to allow the dough to rise.
steps.description: During this hour, begin making the glaze and filling.

steps.headline: Make the glaze.
steps.description: Stir glaze ingredients with a fork in the medium mixing bowl until smooth.

steps.headline: Make the filling.
steps.description: Mix the packed brown sugar and cinnamon with a fork in the small mixing bowl.

steps.headline: Line the cooking tray with aluminum foil then layer it with flour.
steps.description: As soon as the dough has been sitting for one hour, equally spread the dough inside the cooking tray.

steps.headline: Cover the dough with the two tablespoons of soften butter then evenly spread the filling on top.
Warm up the waffle iron to med-high setting.
steps.description: (Be careful, the waffle iron will get very hot!)

steps.headline: Cut 1 inch width strips of dough using the butter knife then begin tightly rolling the strips.
Place the tightly rolled strips onto the waffle iron and begin cooking.
steps.description: Each waffle should take around 2 ½ - 3 ½ minutes long to cook.

steps.headline: Remove the cooked waffles from the waffle iron and drizzle the glaze over the waffles.

text: Making the Dough Microwave the milk in the small microwaveable bowl for 30 seconds. Then dissolve the yeast into the warm milk in the large mixing bowl. Add the eggs, granulated sugar, soften butter, salt, and 4 cups of flour into the large mixing bowl. With the wooden spoon, mix the ingredients well. Sprinkle the rest of the 1/2 cup of flour to knead the dough into a large ball inside the large mixing bowl using your hands.  Cover the large mixing bowl with plastic wrap and leave the bowl on the counter for 1 hour to allow the dough to rise. During this hour, begin making the glaze and filling. Making the Glaze and Filling Make the glaze. Stir glaze ingredients with a fork in the medium mixing bowl until smooth. Make the filling. Mix the packed brown sugar and cinnamon with a fork in the small mixing bowl. Making the Cinnamon Roll Waffles Line the cooking tray with aluminum foil then layer it with flour. As soon as the dough has been sitting for one hour, equally spread the dough inside the cooking tray. Cover the dough with the two tablespoons of soften butter then evenly spread the filling on top.  Warm up the waffle iron to med-high setting. (Be careful, the waffle iron will get very hot!) Cut 1 inch width strips of dough using the butter knife then begin tightly rolling the strips.  Place the tightly rolled strips onto the waffle iron and begin cooking. Each waffle should take around 2 ½ - 3 ½ minutes long to cook. Remove the cooked waffles from the waffle iron and drizzle the glaze over the waffles.
